subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text:
{{Han char|rn=46|rad=山|as=00|sn=3|four=22770|canj=U|ids=⿱丨凵}}

# {{mul-kangxi radical-def}}

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text: * [[Index:Chinese radical/山]]

subSections.title: Chinese
Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – three mountain peaks. In the Oracle Bone Script, they were represented by triangles rather than vertical strokes. Compare {{zh-l|丘}}, particularly earlier forms.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: {{unk|zh}} – cognates not known outside Sino-Bai. Cognate with {{cog|bca|svrt||mountain}} (< Proto-Bai *''sro⁴''). Starostin compares it with {{cog|pdu||sʰôn|mountain}}.
